metadata.title: CVE-2021-47612 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: nfc:fix segfault in nfc_genl_dump_devices_done When kmalloc innfc_genl_dump_devices() fails then nfc_genl_dump_devices_done() segfaultsas below KASAN: null-ptr-deref in range[0x0000000000000008-0x000000000000000f] CPU: 0 PID: 25 Comm: kworker/0:1Not tainted 5.16.0-rc4-01180-g2a987e65025e-dirty #5 Hardware name: QEMUStandard PC (i440FX + PIIX, 1996), BIOS 1.14.0-6.fc35 04/01/2014 Workqueue:events netlink_sock_destruct_work RIP: 0010:klist_iter_exit+0x26/0x80 CallTrace: <TASK> class_dev_iter_exit+0x15/0x20nfc_genl_dump_devices_done+0x3b/0x50 genl_lock_done+0x84/0xd0netlink_sock_destruct+0x8f/0x270 __sk_destruct+0x64/0x3b0sk_destruct+0xa8/0xd0 __sk_free+0x2e8/0x3d0 sk_free+0x51/0x90netlink_sock_destruct_work+0x1c/0x20 process_one_work+0x411/0x710worker_thread+0x6fd/0xa80

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1078-fips - 4.15.0-1078.87
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2061-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2061.63
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2061-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2061.63
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2043-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2043.47
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2043-azure-fips - 4.15.0-2043.47
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2026-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2026.28
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2026-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2026.28
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1078.87').
linux-aws-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2061.63').
linux-azure-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2043.47').
linux-gcp-fips package in fips-updates/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-2026.28').
